data.title: University of Louisville Athletic
data.meta_description: Hercy Miller (15) Guard - Junior Year in 2023-24 Underwent season-ending procedure in February to treat an ongoing hip injury Made his first career start at ...
data.text:
Junior Year in 2023-24

Underwent season-ending procedure in February to treat an ongoing hip injury

Made his first career start at Miami on January 10

Appeared in 10 games with three starts, averaging 4.2 minutes per game

Scored an average of 1.1 points per contest

Sophomore Year in 2022-23

• Appeared in 27 games, averaging 1.8 points and 1.1 rebounds in 7.4 minutes per outing

• One of two players on the roster with a positive assist-to-turnover ratio

• Scored career-high 10 points with two made 3s at Pitt on Feb. 7

• Added five points and six rebounds in a career-high 25 minutes against App State on Nov. 15

• Named to 2022-23 ACC All-Academic Team

Before Louisville

• Transfer guard who played in six of the first seven games as a freshman at Tennessee State in November 2021 before an injury sent him to the sidelines.

• Totaled seven points and two steals against Fisk on Nov. 16, 2021. He averaged 10.2 minutes in six games at TCU, totaling 12 points and five rebounds.

• Averaged 10.6 points per game as a senior in helping Minnehaha Academy in Minneapolis, Minn., to a 20-1 record, a No. 8 national ranking and the school’s fourth straight Class 3A Minnesota state championship and in 2020-21.

• Scored a game-high 24 points in the 2021 state championship game while teaming at Minnehaha with Minnesota Mr. Basketball Chet Holmgren, the nation’s top prospect as a senior who played last season at Gonzaga. Miller was a three-star prospect as a senior in ESPN’s rankings.

Personal:

Born March 28, 2002 ... Son of Sonya and Percy Miller ... Has eight siblings: Mercy, Vercy, Romeo, Veno, Intylyana, Itali, Tytyana and Cympohnique ... Major is business.

Personal goal at UofL is to win a national championship.

Chose to attend UofL because of “the opportunities and love here.”

Enjoys playing the piano, cleaning and playing video games in his spare time.

His father and brothers have had the greatest influence on his athletic career.

The basketball players he most admires are Chris Paul, Kobe Bryant, Michael Jordan, Kyrie Irving, Allen Iverson and Damian Lillard.

Best basketball advice given to him is “nothing is given, everything is earned.”

When he played basketball as a kid, he pretended he was Allen Iverson.

If you walked into his dorm room, the first thing you would notice is how good it smells and how organized it is.

Chose No. 15 jersey because it’s a family number, and his father and brother both wore it.

Favorites:

NBA team: Houston Rockets

Athlete, other than basketball: Francis Tiafoe

Movie: Back to the Future II

Actor: Adam Sandler

Book: The Mamba Mentality

TV Show: Outer Banks, One Tree Hill

Website: Google

Class at UofL: English

Comedian: Kevin Hart

Musical Artist: Travis Scott

Food: Hibachi, pasta

Midnight Snack: Fruit snacks

Vacation spot: Hawaii
